questionsData.title: On the pH scale, low numbers show high acidity.
Juice and tea are liquids.
When sun passes through a raindrop, it creates a rainbow.
Loud sounds are harmless.
Vaccination is the end result of infection by germs.
questionsData.explain_answer:
.Vaccines work by exposing your body to a weakened or inactive form of a virus or bacteria. This triggers your immune system to develop antibodies that can fight off the real disease if you encounter it later. 

diseases are spread by germs.and vaccination using a very weak form of the disease could lead to immunity.

questionsData.explain_answer: Freezing refers to the process of lowering the temperature to  becomes a solid .

questionsData.title: "First-aids" is a kind of disease.
questionsData.explain_answer: "First-aids" is a kind of initial medical provided to people injured in sudden accidents .

questionsData.title: Applicant is someone who runs a company.
"Sincerely" comes at the beginning of the letter.

"Apart" means "away from each other".
The text is mainly talking about ……….
questionsData.article: Pedicab is a small cab that is pulled by a bicycle. It has been (popular 2) in Asian countries for many years. These pedicabs do not take the place of taxis because people use them mainly just for short rides. The passengers of pedicabs are often people who do not want to walk because they are well-dressed for an evening event. Tourists also take them as a fun and an unusual way to get around the (city 1). The drivers of pedicabs are usually friendly students with strong legs. (They 3) pay the owner of the pedicabs a certain amount to use one for a day or evening. Any money they earn from passengers above the amount is their own. Typically, a pedicab driver earns about as much as he or she would earn by working in a restaurant. However, students who have chosen pedicabs say they prefer this kind of work. It may be more tiring, but they enjoy being out-door. They also like the fact that no one is telling them what to do.

questionsData.title: How ……water is there in the tanker?
One of the following is (NOT) a compound word.
They run their new company perfectly. The word "run" is ……
The prefix …… makes the word "correct" negative.
The camel is the …… patient animal.
Both students have the same …….
questionsData.explain_answer:
Both students have the same intelligence.

Here's why:

  • "Intelligence" is a noun that refers to the ability to learn, reason, understand, and think about things.
  • "Intelligent" is an adjective that describes someone who is intelligent.
  • "More intelligent" is a comparative adjective used to compare the intelligence of two people.
  • "Intelligently" is an adverb that modifies a verb and describes how something is done intelligently.

    يتمتع كلا الطالبين بنفس الذكاء.
    الذكاء" هو اسم يشير إلى القدرة على التعلم والتفكير  والفهم والتفكير في الأشياء وهو الخيار الصحيح والاكثر ملائمة .

questionsData.title: They have experience ……. programming computer.
Hythem is the student…….. parents live in Russia.
His family has a house in Sana'a …… to another one in Aden.
He is a very ……runner.
questionsData.explain_answer:
He is a very quick runner.

"quick" is a good adjective to describe someone who can run fast.

  • Quickly and slowly are adverbs, and they modify verbs. In this sentence, we need an adjective to describe the kind of runner he is. Adjectives modify nouns or pronouns.
  • Well can be used in some contexts to describe someone's running, but it usually refers to their technique rather than their speed. For example, "He is a well-trained runner."

questionsData.title: They …..up late yesterday for school.
questionsData.explain_answer: They got up late yesterday for school" is in the past tense. The verb "got" is the past tense form of "get.

questionsData.title: Scientists …….. a new robot in the future.
questionsData.explain_answer: "Scientists will invent a new robot in the future," is grammatically correct and conveys the intended meaning. It uses the future tense verb "will invent" to express a prediction about something that is expected to happen in the future.

questionsData.title: We are …… the news about the recent earthquake.
questionsData.explain_answer:
We are watching the news about the recent earthquake"

is in the present continuous tense. The verb "are watching" is in the present tense, and the addition of "are" before the verb indicates the ongoing or continuous nature of the action.
